intro: Adenostemma angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaf adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as an annual or perennial herb. The plant features opposite, narrow leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. Its stems are usually erect and can become woody with age, and it often thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. Adenostemma angustifolium is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive floral display.
